channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Vanishing of Topological Invariants For Unnormalized Schatten $p$ multiplicative Maps
item.description: arXiv:2509.25869v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A result of Dadarlat shows that nonzero even rational cohomology obstructs the matricial stability of many discrete groups. In the author's previous work, 2-cohomology is used to argue that certain groups are not stable in unnormalized Schatten $p$-norms for $p > 1$, although 2-cohomology is known not to obstruct stability in the unnormalized 2-norm in general. The main result of this paper demonstrates that we should not expect $2k$ cohomology to obstruct in the unnormalized Schatten $p$-norm for $p\ge k$, because the invariant in Dadarlat's argument vanishes for maps that are asymptotically multiplicative in the Schatten $p$-norm.
item.dc:creator: Forrest Glebe

item.title: Separation and excision in functor homology
item.description: arXiv:2503.04251v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove separation and excision results in functor homology. These results explain how the global Steinberg decomposition of functors proved by Djament, Touz{\'e} and Vespa behaves in Ext and Tor computations.
item.dc:creator: Aur\'elien Djament (LAGA), Antoine Touz\'e (LPP)
